result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sandra J Larson

records.addlTxt:
3:20 PM Defendant Sandra J Larson in court.  Attorney Luis Gutierrez in court for Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. for Sandra J Larson. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. The State has no objection to reinstating the signature bond.
Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bond is revoked and forfeited - Failure to appear at jury status.

Attorney Andy Nesheim in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Sandra J Larson. 
Defendant Sandra J Larson not in court. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Case scheduled for 11 am. and Matter called @ 11:20 am.
Jury Trial Cancelled.

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail. 
Court orders a warrant be issued.
Bail is revoked and forfeited.
Body ONLY.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Jury status hearing on September 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Abigail Kincheloe, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Sandra J Larson in court with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   

Defense is requesting the matter be scheduled for a jury trial.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 20, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Defendant to have no contact with any Walmart store.

09:07 AM Defendant Sandra J Larson in court with attorney Cassandra A Miller.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Miller requests a date for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
